Class CheckoutController

java.lang.Object
com.example.bobapos.CheckoutController
public class CheckoutController extends Object
Controller for the checkout screen of the Boba POS application.

This class is responsible for loading menu items from the database, building the UI elements for ordering, tracking the current cart/subtotal, and performing checkout operations that persist sales records. It also exposes methods used by other controllers (for example, to add or modify items) and contains a small nested data-model class `Item`.

Concurrency notes: menu loading runs on a background thread but UI updates occur on the JavaFX application thread. Database connections are obtained via DatabaseConfig.

Error handling: SQLExceptions are logged to stderr; callers should be aware that database operations may fail and handle user-visible errors via JavaFX alerts where appropriate.

  • Constructor Details

    • CheckoutController

      public CheckoutController()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      JavaFX initialize lifecycle method. Loads menu items from the database, constructs UI item boxes, and wires table row handlers. Called after FXML injection completes.

    • handleOrder

      public void handleOrder(CheckoutController.Item item)
      Add the given menu item to the current order/cart. This method is intentionally public so other controllers (for example seasonal menus) may reuse the ordering behavior.
      Parameters:
      item - the menu item to add to the cart

    • checkout

      public void checkout()
      Perform checkout for the current cart.

      This method calculates the total (including tax), creates a new sales record in the database inside a transaction, and clears the current order on success. Any SQL errors will roll back the transaction and be logged.

    • cancel

      public void cancel()
      Cancel the current order: clears the table view, item counts and resets the subtotal to zero.

    • refreshItems

      public void refreshItems()
      Refresh the list of menu items from the database and rebuild the UI container that displays available items.

    • cleanup

      public void cleanup()
      Close any held database connection resources. Intended to be called when the controller is disposed.

    • modMenu

      public void modMenu(CheckoutController.Item item, javafx.scene.control.TableRow<CheckoutController.Item> row)
      Open the modifications dialog for a given item when the user requests to modify a row (typically via right-click).
      Parameters:
      item - the item to modify
      row - the table row that triggered the modification
